newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rubber stable in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rubber stable in late trading.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber prices were stable in late trading on Wednesday on the back of improved market sentiment, traders said.
They said European buyers bought rubber at 48.00 U.S. cents/lb fob Palembang for August shipment. Offer prices in other trading centres were generally stable with a few bids reported.
"Market sentiment is improving as demand has been coming in the past few days. What we can do is hope this trend will continue through the week to keep our spirits high," one trader said.
Traders said supply was generally tight in most of the centres, except for Palembang where tappers had started tapping again after a recent spate of rain had ended.
Traders said offer prices were quoted at 48.50 fob Medan, 48.00 fob Padang, 48.25 fob Surabaya and 47.75 fob Pontianak and Jambi.
